messages.message: Please download the latest ViaVersion plugins from the <#698284788074938388> channel. Remember to delete your old `.jar` files before downloading the new ones.

Please update your proxy to the latest version to support 1.8 - latest release clients:
**Velocity** - https://papermc.io/downloads#Velocity
**BungeeCord** - https://ci.md-5.net/job/BungeeCord

If you were kicked for "You are sending too many packets!", change `max-pps` in the ViaVersion `config.yml` to either a higher number or -1 to disable it. Use `/viaversion pps` in-game to view how many packets players are sending.

If your players are getting kicked for spam, it's due to 1.13+'s tab-complete executing too fast.

Ways to solve this:
- Update ViaVersion from <#698284788074938388> and edit `1_13-tab-complete-delay: 5` in the config. 5 is suggested to avoid kicking.
- Disable tab-complete for 1.13+ using `disable-1_13-auto-complete: true` in the config.
- If you use Paper 1.17.1+ then you can change the spam limit in paper.yml *(or in config/paper-global.yml if using 1.19+)* instead.

If you want ViaVersion to calculate how to connect blocks for 1.13+ make sure you set `serverside-blockconnections: true` in the ViaVersion config. This was previously disabled by default as it uses slightly more CPU per player.

You can use https://via.krusic22.com/ to generate the list for `block-protocols` in the ViaVersion config, this will allow you to allow / deny specific versions.
You can also use `block-versions` to specify blocked versions by using its minecraft name ("1.17") and operands like `< >`. For example `"<1.17"` will only allow 1.17.x and above to join.
*(You can also use https://viaversion.com/setup to generate the list)*

messages.plugin: To fix console spam, use `suppress-conversion-warnings: true` and `suppress-metadata-errors: true` in the ViaVersion `config.yml`. The errors will still happen but you won't be spammed with them and the issues will be ignored.
messages.mod: To fix log spam, use `suppress-conversion-warnings: true` and `suppress-metadata-errors: true` in the viaversion.yml (located in `config/viafabricplus/ViaLoader`). The errors will still happen but you won't be spammed with them and the issues will be ignored.
messages.proxy: To fix log spam, use `suppress-conversion-warnings: true` and `suppress-metadata-errors: true` in the viaversion.yml (located in `ViaLoader`). The errors will still happen but you won't be spammed with them and the issues will be ignored.

messages.message: Please only install Via* plugins on either Bungee/Velocity **OR** backend servers *(e.g. Spigot / Paper / Sponge)*. We recommend **backend servers** because it will give ViaVersion more information and a better experience.

This is an example of how the mapping works in Via:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Jo0001/ViaRemapping/master/1.20-1.19.png

Here are the officially supported platforms:
Paper and Spigot as a **plugin**,
Sponge as a **sponge plugin**,
Bungeecord as a **plugin**, *(Run the latest version of the proxy!)*
Velocity as a **plugin**, *(Run the latest version of the proxy!)*
Fabric 1.8/1.14+ as a mod. Requires **ViaFabric (Plus)** and **Fabric API** for your game version,
Standalone as **proxy** with ViaaaS & ViaProxy.

For a overview checkout - https://viaversion.com/suite


*Side note: As a network owner, running Via on the backend servers is recommended even if you have a ViaVersion compatible proxy.*

**ViaVersion is causing TPS lag in timings?**

ViaVersion for versions 1.9 and above on 1.8 has to simulate player ticking for them to eat, draw bows, etc. This means our plugin looks like it's causing lag but it's actually calling Minecraft server methods. You can turn off `nms-player-ticking` in the ViaVersion `config.yml` to use an alternate method that won't touch timings but may cause issues with anti-cheat.

Specify how 1.8.x clients should see the cooldown indicator
In the Via**Rewind** `config.yml` set `cooldown-indicator: ` to
 `TITLE`,`ACTION_BAR`,`BOSS_BAR` or `DISABLED`
*Note: This will only hide the cooldown, not disable it!*
Information about how to use the Via API in the latest release can be found here: https://gist.github.com/KennyTV/3778685985ddc45bd99e003191ff02eb
**That issue is not from Via, it's from the plugin shown in the stack trace. Try the latest version of that plugin or contact the author of it and tell them to update the Via API usage.**
There is a current issue with BungeeTabListPlus and the latest Minecraft update, we suggest following their discord for updates.

**Do not use the `/reload` command**. It will cause issues with your server and its plugins. For more information, see https://madelinemiller.dev/blog/problem-with-reload/
*Note: You can safely use `/minecraft:reload` to reload datapacks.*

Every player on 1.7.x - 1.16.5 can still play on a 1.18+ server but **the new world height is not supported** *(players are stuck below y=0 & only see void)*

*To avoid/revert this, use a datapack or downgrade back to 1.17.1 or only allow 1.17+ players, see https://gist.github.com/Jo0001/4fe96cf5a78c8a00560ea985f3b9eb22 for more information.*

messages.plugin:
**How to perform a binary search:**

1. Remove half of the existing plugins and put them aside for now,
2. Run the server again,
3. Is it still creating errors from there?

*(If yes; Repeat from step 1 with current items)*
*(If not; Swap out the current plugins with the ones set aside and repeat from step 1)*

4. Repeat process until problematic plugin/s are found.
messages.mod:
**How to perform a binary search:**

1. Remove half of the existing mods and put them aside for now,
2. Run the client again,
3. Is it still creating errors from there?

*(If yes; Repeat from step 1 with current items)*
*(If not; Swap out the current mods with the ones set aside and repeat from step 1)*

4. Repeat process until problematic mod/s are found.

**To resolve the "Missing profile public key" issue:**

1. You need to disable `enforce-secure-profile` in server.properties file via 1.19 or later backend server(s),

2. If you have velocity as your proxy; ensure that `force-key-authentication` is set to false in the velocity.toml file, *(+ Please try Legacy Forwarding if modern fails)*

3. If you have bungeecord as your proxy instead; ensure that `enforce_secure_profile` is set to false in the bungeecord's config.yml file,

4. The **Chat messages can't be verified** toast can be removed from clients by deploying the FreedomChat plugin into your paper/purpur servers which requires no configuration from it *(the plugin can be found on Modrinth)*,

**Versions of FreedomChat that work:**

1.2.1 = 1.19.1/2,
1.3.1 = 1.19.3,
1.4.2 = 1.19.4,
1.5.0 = 1.20/1.20.1,
1.5.1 = 1.20.2,
1.5.2 = 1.20.3/1.20.4.

5. Disabling the enforced secure profiling system **doesn't** pose a security risk nor has anything to do with the `online-mode` boolean in practice, Although we aren't responsible for any issues caused by this entire setup.
Here's a short wiki section on how to edit ViaBackwards mappings *(items, blocks, sounds)*: https://github.com/ViaVersion/ViaBackwards/wiki
